Target Audience:    Um.....

Video Review:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xdmKgmgaHrc

Summary:

Look, I hate writing reviews like this. But Side Quest is the blandest of action games that needs to understand where it fails: it's an side-scrolling action game that doesn't execute anything well, and doesn't have any appeal. The gameplay is basic in the worse ways: as the KISS principle (keep it simple stupid) is misused in the wrong way: it's so basic, it's boring. You can get combat variety in several ways, you don't need combos even if you use level design/enemy design/visual flair correctly, but Side Quest does none of those. The game has shown you exactly what it has to offer within the first 15 minutes (for the most part), and really doesn't take it from there. It's also a technical mess: art assets are inconsistent and the game has portions where the hit detection doesn't work at all. Look, I don't like being brutal with new developers like this, but in order for them to improve, you have to be. And needless to say, Side Quest doesn't do the job at any level: it fails to get the attention.

Lists:
Positives:
The one boss fight is better then most of the game.....
It's got a couple of nice art assets.
Maybe you'll get a laugh out of the awkward dialogue
Negatives:
Boring. Boring Boring Boring. No pizzaz, no it factor, no oompf. Way too basic to keep anyone’s attention over time.
Repetitive. You've got a melee/ranged attack, and be ready to repeatedly use them over and over and over again. Because that's all you're going to do.
I hate to say this, but I literally feel asleep playing the game.
Game is short from what I see. Even though I really didn't want to play anymore after an hour, it's got achievements to beat the game under 40 minutes. And with not a lot of replay value, that could be a problem.
Hit detection problems in several places,despite being in clear range of hitting the enemy.
Art assets are all over the place, and don't seem to fit the same art style with each other.
Missing options like the ability to turn off music. Glitchy at times.
